SENT.plain: Syringomyelia classically presents with slowly progressing dissociated sensory and upper and lower motor deficits
Atypical and acute manifestations have rarely been described
We report here on 3 patients with syringomyelia, who had acute and atypical brainstem symptoms with regard to the underlying disease
These symptoms occurred after acute elevation of the intrathoracic and intra-abdominal pressure, respectively, and remitted subsequently
